intro: Galega pallens, commonly known as the white goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that grows up to 1 meter tall, featuring slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Galega pallens is noted for its ornamental value and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
